IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT THE HISTORY OF WORLD WAR II AIRCRAFT.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC ABOUT THE HISTORY OF WORLD WAR II AIRCRAFT.
IRS990.Description: TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC INCLUDING THE YOUNG ABOUT THE HISTORY OF WORLD WAR II AIRCRAFT AND TO HONOR THE VETERANS OF THAT WAR. ALSO TO RESTORE, PRESERVE AND OPERATE AMERICA'S LEGENDARY FIGHTERS, BOMBERS AND TRAINERS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: GIFT SHOP COST OF GOODS SOLD $121082 OTHER EXPENSE NOT INCLUDED IN SALE $-20

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part III, Line 4: Description of organization's collections and how it furthers its purpose.
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: To accomplish our mission, the Palm Springs Air Museum uses the following components of the collection: One of the world's largest collections of flying WW2 warplanes, Rare and original combat photography, Original artworks, including enormous murals, Artifacts, memorabilia, and uniforms of WW2, Comprehensive graphics and historical themes, Continuous video documentaries

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part III, Line 1a: If organization elected under SFAS 116 to not report are, historical treasures, o
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Collections:Collection items are capitalized at cost if the items were purchased, or at their appraised or fair value if donated. The Museum has a large collection of historical items in its library that have not been capitalized. The Museum also has several collection items on loan which are not reflected in these financial statements.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE AT THE MAIN OFFICE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION FOR THE PRESIDENT/CEO IS REVIEWED AND DETERMINED BY THE OFFICERS OF THE CORPORATION (NOT INCLUDING THE PRESIDENT/CEO) ONCE EACH YEAR, IN NOVEMBER.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A QUESTIONNAIRE GIVEN OUT TO EMPLOYEES ASKING THEM TO LIST ANY FINANCIAL INTEREST OR BUSINESS DEALINGS WITH WHICH THE PALM SPRINGS AIR MUSEUM HAS BUSINESS DEALINGS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE DRAFTS OF THE ANNUAL AUDIT AND IRS FORM 990 ARE PRESENTED TO THE CHAIR OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW.
